dialogues.text: Haley looks great. I hear Chris DeFrank expects her back at his gym as soon as she‘s eighteen. Vickerman is put-off, even a bit miffed at this news.

dialogues.text: Hey, Haley! Chris DeFrank thinks you're going to end up back at his gym. Whaddya think? Haley jogs over, joining them. Vickerman high roads it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: If Haley wants to go back and train with Chris eventually, that’s up to sher. Haley looks at Vic with respect. Gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I think if Chris DeFrank had wanted me to keep training with him, he should’ve thought about that before he started boning my Mom. Haley walks away, leaving a stunned group of judges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley is at the pay phone, alone. It’s dark. She's nervou  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 56.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: {into phone, leaving a message) Hey, Dad. Sorry to bother you. I just wanted you to know I’m working hard here, and I’m going to try and pay you back for the window and stuff. I’m competing at this thing, and if I win, I’ll give you all the money. (long pause) Okay. That’s it. I just wanted you to know I’m not goofing around. Okay, then. Bye. Haley looks at the phone, and hangs up. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devon hands Haley a neatly folded warm-up and leo...and t drops it on the floor at her feet before walking away. Ha picks it up as Lacey works beam behind her.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Lacey's on beam, throwing a full-twisting back to a strad through and “crotches the beam.” Hard. Instinctively, Lac grabs onto the beam, circling around and hangs by her kne before falling flat to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LACEY, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Owowowowowowowowow. 2 Vickerman appears. Assesses the situation. Gets it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: (calling out) Joanne! Pack your stuff. Joanne does an ecstatic riverdance with no care for Lacey feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DORRIE and GIRLS unload the mini-van, a CAR pulls up a starts HONKING. The VGA crew turns to see  od STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 57. A CONVERTIBLE with FOUR COLLEGE HOTTIES crammed inside. T CUTE GUYS head out of the Arena, running towards the car KISSING TWO OF THE GIRLS and hopping in. The car peals ou in a fun blare of MUSIC and LAUGHTER. ON JOANNE, MINA, WEI WEI and HALEY, watching the life the missing with more than a little angst.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: I'd kill for a boyfriend. The GIRLS look at her, like, whoa --

dialogues.text: That’s a strategy. Boys love violence.

dialogues.speaker: DORRIE
dialogues.text: Chins up, walk tall, point your toes and do not fall! WE HANG BEHIND THE VGA GIRLS, walking in matching gear towards the double doors of a small arena. ON HALEY, glancing back with a longing look at the car an its’ occupants-before heading inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SIGNAGE: “Welcome to the FRIENDSHIP CUP,” underneath i are two additional signs with OPPOSING ARROWS for “ARTIST GYMNASTICS" and "T&T.” Vick and crew follow the AG arrow. ‘ MINA What‘s T&T? Haley assesses the timing before pulling Mina the other w

dialogues.text: Trampoline and tumbling. Power tumbling. Come on.

dialogues.text: A WOMEN’S SYNCHRO DUO practice on side-by-side TRAMPOLINE OTHER SYNCHRO TEAMS wait their turn. TIGHT ON HI-TECH SPRING RODS getting secured into an EIGH FOOT LONG runway. ON MINA AND HALEY, rushing over to watch this strange wor

dialogues.text: ON POWER TUMBLING GIRL sprinting into an EXPLOSION of consecutive TUMBLING SKILLS that WHIZ and THUMP by with awesome speed, power and velocity. ON MINA, as if she’s seeing God and home all at once.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Can she try it? The PT Girl nods. Mina races like a banshee to the runway

dialogues.speaker: PT GIRL
dialogues.text: You can do eight of whatever you want. Whipbacks feel awesome. Mina wastes no time, launching into a Power Tumbling pass like she was born to do it. She lands, exploding into gid ecstasy. PT Girl’s impressed.

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: It’s like NASCAR for girls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPECTATORS taking their seats; JUDGES getting oriented be their tables; GYMNASTS warming up in pairs and trios. ON JOANNE, signing programs and getting tons of attention YOUNG FANS, are SCREAMING her name from the stands. TIGHT ON: A ROW of FEET, in peds and barefoot...lining up what‘’s known as the March-In. NEW ANGLE as the FEET march onto the diagonal of the Floo mat for their presentation to the Judges and the crowd. O of these pairs of feet in BLACK CHUCK CONNORS.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: (shout-whispering) Haley! Take those off!! ON HALEY, rolling her eyes and KICKING OFF her CC‘s witho Missing a step. ON THE PERFECT LINE OF COMPETITORS, backs straight and in position. Except for Haley, with hands on hips and her hi jutting out, one of these girls is NOT like the others.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MINA, now totally pumped. AND WEI WEI, looking complet overwhelmed. Haley joins them. Focused.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Don’t be nervous. Wei Wei looks at her like she wants to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: WEI WET
dialogues.text: Carly Janiga and Tia Orlando. Here.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Trust me: they’re not thinking about you. Concentrate on the judges. Make them look. Don’t ask them to look at you in a sweet tone of voice as if they are doing you a favor. Make them look. And if you eat mat? Eat mat hard. But make them look. Wei Wei seems to pump up.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: This is your chance to make a noise. So show em what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: POOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Graham Cracker! ON POOT AND FRANK in the stands, waving furiously.
ON THE GIRLS, doe-eyed. Haley knows boys!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley is warming up her tough stuff on vault. Incredulous Vick watches her a beat, and moves in for a chat.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Hi, crazy. How's crazy-land? What are you doing? Money or funny?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I'm doing what I practiced.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 60.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: If you want the money? I‘d back off a hair.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I want the money and I want to throw what I can throw.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: You are landing your doubles fifty percent at best. If that. So why not just do a one and a half?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: It‘s not about hitting, it’s about expressing something. And I haven‘t been practicing my one and a half. I don’t think I even remember how to do it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Haley. I want you to get what you came for. The purse.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: You just don’t want to look bad.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Of course I don’t want the club to look bad. But you’re not here to impress the judges. You're here to place top three, win some money and get out. So stick it, alright? Haley’s-not sure, but she shakes her head anyway. Remembering. She doesn’t want to be a gymnast, right?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: You stick it, you gross old man. Haley smiles. Vick smiles. He's gotten through to her.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Accuracy counts, Haley. I'ma gross, middle-aged man. Vick leaves the girls by the vault. Wei Wei‘s nervous. ON JUDGES, giving Wei Wei the GREEN LIGHT. ON WEL WEI, saluting and singing with ferocity as she rac down the runway and nails it but for a tiny step back.  7 STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 61. ON MINA AND HALEY AND JOANNE AND VICK, stunned. Wei Wei jumps into Vick’s arms. THE CROWD goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: I'm in for the one and a half and the double. . Vickerman is busy congratulating WW. Haley sees this and walks Mina to the Vault podium. They adjust her beat boar at the vault before heading to the head of the runway.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Double it. You can do the one and a half as your second if you screw up, right? Vault's the one place you get do-overs. NASCAR it up. Mina nods confidently. Haley changes her vault number and heads back down to the waiting area as Mina chalks up.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: She alright?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Fuel-injected. ON JUDGES, giving the green light. ON MINA, saluting and staring down the runway with intens Her run is thunderous. Her face contorted. She throws a double-twisting Yurchenko. Her power and distance from th horse are palpable. And she sticks it. The crowd ROARS. ON HALEY AND VICKERMAN, blown away.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: That girl can vault. Who changed her number? Haley sheepishly raises her hand, Vickerman would kill he but picks up the elated Mina. Haley's up. Vick goes to se Haley's number for the judges. AT VAULT RUNWAY, Haley looks really nervous all of a sudd The CROWD starts BOOING.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCORE
dialogues.text: ON MINA, disappointed. Haley’s furious. Joanne is shocked

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Even I think that‘s low.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 62. ON HALEY, chalking up and looking super annoyed. Vickerma adjusts the beat board. Haley waves him back over.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: You know what? Put me down for a one and a half. It’s pointless. I’m not chancing getting screwed by them again. I want the money. Vickerman is stunned, shocked and relieved.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Really? No double? Seriously? Haley shakes her head, no. Vick changes her vault number quickly. Haley preps her body. She gets the GREEN LIGHT. Haley salutes. Breathes. Mumbling to herself. ON HALEY, running and vaulting a watered-down, one and a Yurchenko. Stuck cold. ON MINA AND WEI WEI, sharing a ‘huh?’ look. APPLAUSE. As Haley exits the vault podium, Vick pats her on the bac Haley walks past Mina and WW, who are totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: That was weird.

dialogues.speaker: WEI WEI
dialogues.text: Where’s the double? Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: iI chickened at the last minute. That doesn’t ring completely true to Mina or Wei Wei. Or Haley. Haley shrugs. Vickerman’s happy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: You did the right thing, Haley. Way to go. Mina and WW trade looks; what does that mean? ON JOANNE’S VAULT: clean, with a much bigger step than WW

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: If your feet move, it‘s not a stick. We'll see how the judges score that.

dialogues.speaker: WEI WEI
dialogues.text: (to Mina) That sucks. Her step was so bigger than mine. Mina and WW can’t believe it. Joanne gloats as they gathe their stuff for the bar rotation.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Bigger reputation plus bigger step equals higher score. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Stop being nasty, Joanne.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: It’s not called gym-nicestics. Suddenly, A COMPETITOR wipes out on her vault right in fr of them. Joanne gives her a look, like, “See?”

dialogues.speaker: HALEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And like a sneeze, one really bad wipeout can give an entire meet the flu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As GYMNAST after GYMNAST wipes out: a fall off the beam; butt-landing on floor; stepping out of bounds on vault; a three consecutive missed release moves on bars. Girls are tanking. i HALEY (V.0.) And all you can do is hope like hell you don‘t catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickerman and crew and cheering Mina on from the sideline

dialogues.speaker: WEI WEI
dialogues.text: Come on, Mina! Hit the release, you can do it! Eat mat hard! MID-ROUTINE, ON MINA, missing the bar on a release move - ON VICK, spotting and missing her. ON MINA, eating mat. It is a spread-eagle stomach slam. Chalk dust blowing everywhere.  — STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 64. ON POOT, FRANK AND SOME SPECTATORS, wincing and GROANING. ON WEI WEI, covering her mouth as if she caused it. ON JUDGES, scribbling their heiroglyphics on her score ca ON HALEY AND WEI WEI, cheering her on as she remounts and hits the rest of her routine.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: S‘alright, Mina! Shake it off! ON MINA, dismounting and disappointed and SNEEZES. Twice. ON HALEY, clocking the sneeze with a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WEI WEI saluting, shaken from Mina’s fall. She mounts bar with a difficult series of Stalders and hits her rele moves, including two hop fulls and a Kovacs. Wei Wei dismounts but PUTS HER HANDS DOWN on the landing. The CROWD GROANS. Haley cheers her on, but Wei Wei‘’s ups as she descends the stairs to the waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: No worries, Wei Wei! Good job. ON WEI WEI‘S SCORE: 9.2 ON JOANNE, getting ready and walking by WW, smug. i JOANNE Nice stick. JOANNE’S ROUTINE is steady and boring. Joanne dismounts. ON JOANNE‘S SCORE: 9.512 ON HALEY consoling WEI WEI, who's distraught.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Exxon, you're up. You good?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I have no idea. As Haley ascends the podium, Mina gives her a fist pump.

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: NASCAR it up, Haley!  sd STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 65. ON HALEY ON BARS, executing a very standard routine. ON WEI WEI and MINA, confused. Joanne sidles up.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: That routine is so old it farts dust. It's from Junior Nationals. Like three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: Where are her release moves? What she’s doing? That’s so easy! Joanne is smug, taunting.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: I hope you guys get that Haley is a total phony. The only reason she’s encouraging you guys to go for the harder tricks is so you'll mess up and she wins the prize money. (goading)} You didn’t really buy all that ‘go for it’ crap, did you? You want a team sport? Try soccer. Haley does an easy dismount and sticks it. She looks humiliated and embarrassed as she descends the podium.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: You got nothing to be ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say. You have no ‘shame. ON HALEY’S SCORE: 9.612 ON WEI WEI AND MINA, totally grossed out by her result. Haley watches COACH DUANE MARVIN talking to a very upset competitor, LESLIE RUSSO. Leslie is looking straight ahea erying as her coach talks at her, rubbing her elbow.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MARVIN
dialogues.text: Suck it up. Just go out there and do your routine.

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: The doctor said to stop if it hurts. Can't Julie go?  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 66.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MARVIN
dialogues.text: (irritated) Julie doesn't have your start value. (back pat) You want more tape? . Leslie shakes her head no, clearly knowing her pain is falling on deaf ears. ON HALEY, watching Leslie with some mild concern. ON LESLIE, closing her eyes and breathing, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM-MATES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: C’mon, Leslie! WIDER ON LESLIE looking impossibly tiny in the arena. ON THE JUDGES, giving Leslie the green light. ON LESLIE, stepping up to the bars, touching the low bar, saluting and stepping off. And walking off the podium. ON THE JUDGES, looking at her to be sure she knows what s doing, then marking her as a scratch. Coach Marvin's yelling as she marches off the podium.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MARVIN
dialogues.text: You don’t scratch unless I tell you to scratch! I can’t even look at you. ON LESLIE‘S SCORE: flashing a 0.00

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The score for Leslie Russo is a zero point o. ON LESLIE, sitting down as Haley approaches her. Leslie p her head on her knees. Haley exhales sympathetically, following her club-mates to the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are reapplying make-up. Chilly environment.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Mina Hoyt. First gymnast to stick a layout-layout full on balance beam. You‘re about to go down in history.  we STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 67. Mina and Wei Wei say nothing, and go about their business

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Don‘t bum on the falls. It sucks you fell, but you made them look. .

dialogues.speaker: MINA
dialogues.text: Oh, I see how it is. You tell us to take a risk, but then you play it safe and get a huge score? How convenient. Haley’s silent. They’re right.

dialogues.speaker: WEI WEI
dialogues.text: You want to win the purse. We get it. Drop the act.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Wait - it's not that simple, you guys - let me explain! They are being corralled back out to beam before Haley ha chance to explain. Haley looks guilt-ridden and can’t arg she is selling out and she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Haley! Haley, honey! Over here! IN THE CORRIDOR, Haley's mother Alice is waving furiously Haley makes her way over as Alice over-eagerly hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: ;Oh, sweetheart! I miss you, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You‘’re doing a great job. Nice sets so far. (motioning up to stands) I’m here with Chris. We want to talk to you. Haley‘’s old coach, CHRIS DEFRANK, waves from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: About what?  4

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: About you coming back and training with him. It doesn't look good to have you training with someone else. We need you back with us. Haley looks at her mother, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: And until I’m eighteen you aren‘t allowed to see me without a court- appointed guardian present.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: And after that, you will come back to Chris’s gym. Especially since you are performing so well -- we need a united front again. (pissed) And I really don’t appreciate you mouthing off to judges when it comes to family business. It was all over the message boards.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: United front? I’m done fronting for you. Or anyone.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You should be thanking your lucky stars that judge gave you the shot to be this good again. You should be grateful you‘re being given a second chance after throwing your ieareer away like a crazy person. All the years I slaved, chauffering you back and forth for your training. Who's the crazy person?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: It's safe to say you were getting a little more out of it than a long drive.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (disgusted) We were this close to the Olympics. This close. 68.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 69.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: We? What event were you competing on? Boxsprings? Alice takes a deep breath. There’s that stage mother thin

dialogues.speaker: HALEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom. Six girls go to the Olympics. I was not going to be one of them.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: No respect for your talent. For Chris. Me. For anything.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I don’t respect people who don’t respect me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Oh, and I suppose you think Burt Vickerman respects you. .

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: In his way. Yeah, I do, actually.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: The only thing Burt Vickerman respects is money. He cares about cash and cashing in. And if your father hadn’t paid him off you'd be sitting at Texas Military Academy right now. What? Haley’s hit hard. This does not compute. i

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Paid him off? What do you mean paid him off? Everyone there pays.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Not as much as you! Your daddy‘s paying four times what every other girl there is paying. Haley blinks, grabs a railing. Grips it. Her eyes wide, taking it in. She’s stunned. She tries to swallow but can‘t. It hurts too much.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Did you think he was on your side? He's a coach, Haley. He only has one side: his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +t tt  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 70. In the B.G., Vickerman yells from the balance beam podium irritated.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Haley, come warm up! C‘mon! Haley‘s floored, ali of her faith in vick and his kindnes gone. Vick waves more urgently, pointing to his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Haley! Let‘s warm up beam. Let's go, go, go! Haley is furious. Stung with betrayal. Fighting tears.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (clueless) You're doin‘ good hon, keep it up! Horrified, Haley swallows it and runs out and up onto the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- beam podium to do her warm-up with the rest of her clu Immediately, Haley’s throwing her hardest tricks. Vickerm clocks the reckless intensity immediately.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: What‘s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Everything. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: A finger hits a switch; A GREEN LIGHT illuminates. TIGHT ON HALEY, fiercer than we've ever seen her, salutin THE HEAD BEAM JUDGE saluting back. ALL SOUND vanishes, and only Haley’s BREATHING, HEARTBEAT and SOUNDS of her BODY on THE EQUIPMENT remain. WIDER reveals the intensity of her approach to the beam, is the athlete who made the World Team. Nothing will distract her. She is going to show everything she’s got. ON HALEY, charging into her mount with a rock-solid landi A DULL CROWD CHEER can be heard through HALEY‘’S SFX.

dialogues.speaker: STICK IT
dialogues.text: Haley presses into a handstand. Then raises one arm into perfect one-armed handstand. She looks like a star. The BLOOD RUSHING into her ears, INCREASING her HEARTBEAT. HALEY‘S POV: ON THE NAUGAHYDE, her hands gripping the bea she raises one hand. In SLO-MO, A SINGLE TEARDROP hits th top of the beam. Then another. REVERSE POV: Haley is crying in a handstand. Haley presses down into a straddle-V strength balance. Sh holds it despite the tears, before her transition into a series. She bobbles badly. Mascara streaking down her pla face. ALL SOUNDS in the ARENA returning, getting louder. ON THE JUDGES, not registering any emotion. PENCILS formi the petroglyphs from the opening; the Code of Points. BACK WITH HALEY, any remaining composure gone. She punch- fronts with BOTH FEET, SLO-MO into the air, falling badly ON VICK, waving telling her to calm down. Mina and Wei We watch, shocked, from the sidelines. Even Joanne is stunne ON HALEY, wiping her eyes with her sleeve, getting back u beam, cartwheels into a simple back tuck. And takes a million steps back on the landing. The crowd GROANS. ON HALEY, sitting on the mat. In an altered state. Haley gets back up, tears streaming down her face. She salutes THE JUDGES, who tally her rampant deductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calmly, Haley descends the podium and grabs her bag. She scans the stands, finding Poot and Frank. Giving a metal salute and pointing to the exit. They see she needs them. VICKERMAN corralling Dorrie, who goes to the team. He fol Haley out of the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears of humiliation and betrayal streaming down Haley’s cheeks. Vick is chasing after her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0,S.)
dialogues.text: And the score for Haley Graham is an eight point three two.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 72.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Haley, don‘t do this!

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Let me guess: Is this you fighting for me to be here? .

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Let's go back in there and finish this meet.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Blah blah blah. Don‘t I sound like I really care, Haley? Don’t I? Cause I care, I really care, he lied.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Stop it. Don’t bail again, Haley. Finish this meet. Finish it for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: For me? Yeah, you said something about the fact this was about me. About my freedom. Helping me. You forgot to tell me the part where you were cashing in on it. Was that what you were fighting for? How much you'd get paid? Vickerman knows exactly what she’s talking about.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: ;Oooh - brilliant coach reforms troubled teen and saves his ailing reputation. It is a long tunnel. The light is back in the arena. This exit is dark.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: I meant everything I said to you, Haley, everything. I never lied to you.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Everything you said to me was an insurance policy to get those fat checks from my father. Your word was bought and paid for.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 73.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t have to say that stuff, Haley. I said it because it made sense.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Dollars and cents.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERMAN

dialogues.text: fi two year hiatus is an fantasy in the short career of a gymnast. But Haley Graham is looking to turn that fantasy into reality at these Championships, Elfie.

dialogues.text: Look, Tricia. I didn’t mean to wreck your Worlds. (really trying) My family was...disintegrating... and I want you to know I’m really sorry it affected you. I sent you a note. Apologizing. (knowing it sounds lame) I don‘t know if you got it or not. Tricia stares at her with hatred and walks away. Haley's flustered, returning to her bag and plopping on the floor the athlete's area, nervously taping her ankles, looking something between her feet. REVERSE ON GYMNASTS, calculating and writing down her sco TIGHT ON A MALE JUDGE crying. THE CAMERA SPINS, revealing terrified judge hanging under the balance beam, legs and clutching for dear life. Letting go, he falls out of fram with a THUD and an OW. ON VAULT, A REALLY OLD JUDGE runs down the vault runway, doing a nice round-off entry. JUMP CUT and the Judge's bo is now a dummy, which flies violently off the vault, OVER LANDING FOAM, and into the BLEACHERS.

dialogues.text: Whatever you do don’t picture them naked. It’s really gross. INT. VAULT ROTATION JUDGES PANEL . An irate VICKERMAN is protesting Mina’s score.

GREEN LI She salutes, before pulling her bra strap out so it shows ON VICKERMAN, enjoying her spunk with a big nod of approv ON HALEY, pausing before pulling the other strap out. ON THE JUDGES, looking at her and marking it down.  STICK IT - 28 02/11/2005 96.

dialogues.text: (re: straps) It’s part of my routine. ON HALEY‘S SCORECARDS, the stenography for the deduction getting marked on EACH of the FOUR CARDS. ON HALEY, who does her vault. Perfectly. dialogues.text: This is totally scrunched up.

dialogues.text: You don‘t know? 4

Staring down the judges and officials.

dialogues.text: Hey, Grindy, how’s that axe? Haley‘s distracted. Ivan and Dorrie dance drunkenly.

dialogues.text: It is broken. It’s totally broken! We could decide who is the best and most innovative on each apparatus. v

dialogues.text: And Beth Holtan is the best on beam and we've never seen her on * broadcast cause she gets deducted for doing original stuff and never Places top three. She had to water down her routine just to make event finals, right?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: iRita.

dialogues.text: Am I bananas or does anyone else agree with me? Mina and Wei Wei and Gloria raise their hands. The other girls look scared. Joanne takes this as a good sign.

dialogues.text: T don’t know yet.

BETWEEN TIM AND ELFIE, a shrug. ONE BY ONE, EACH FINALIST throws down her jacket until it gets to Joanne. ON JOANNE, pausing, seeing her mother in the stands. Joan throws hers in as well.

dialogues.text: Five zeroes. This has never happened before. The CROWD IS BUZZING with COACHES and PARENTS freaking! ON RITA, chalking up. dialogues.text: Come on, Rita! Stick it, Rita! {THE AUDIENCE is looking down. On the edges of their seat not sure what is happening. OFFICIALS scrambling and YELL

Pure poet LOW ANGLE as her feet near the floor, and HIGH FRAME RATE her feet stick to the mat. Like qlue.

dialogues.text: If she does not get a ten on this, there is no justice. ON THE JUDGES, not looking at each other. They feel the pressure, and are not quite sure of what just happened. ON THEIR PADS, FOUR GLYPHS for a perfect Tsuk Piked. ON THE VAULTING FINALISTS, nervously awaiting Rita‘s scor

dialogues.text: ON THE FINALISTS, hugging Rita ecstatically! THE CROWD and ANNOUNCERS going NUTS!

dialogues.text: ON JOANNE saluting. She touches the lower bar, salutes ag and walks away, thumbing her bra out in solidarity. THREE MORE SCRATCHES from GLORIA, REBECCA and HALEY. i ON THE MEET DIRECTOR, conferring nervously with a GROUP. REBECCA and HER COACH are talking to them. ON HALEY and WEI WEI, concerned. ANOTHER SCRATCH: from LESLIE. ON WEI WEI, at the chalk bowl. Vickerman is smirking.

dialogues.text: An editorial philharmonic: atomic chalk dust; trick time; APPARATUS CAM; POV’S and ECU'S of every which Wei Wei. A festival of facial expressions, hands, legs, speed, grace amplitude and effort on this bitch of an apparatus. The routine is full of high-flying, full-twisting release mov Before her dismount she stops, standing on the high bar, pumping her fist twice, then giant-swinging into a double twisting double back dismount. Stuck cold. ON THE JUMBOTRON, Wei Wei showing tons of emotion. ON TIM AND ELFIE, speechless.  w STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 108.

dialogues.text: I‘m speechless, Elfie.

dialogues.text: We'll re-record something later, Tim. : Off their stunned and impressed expressions we CUT TO THE WAITING AREA as Wei Wei rushes down to hugs and goodw from her competitors.

dialogues.text: Because there are alternates who would like to compete. REVERSE REVEALS TRICIA SKILKEN and TWO OTHER GYMNASTS, ar crossed, staring down the girls. ON THE GIRLS, looking uneasy. Especially Rebecca Blank.  STICK IT - 2B 02/11/2005 109.

dialogues.text: There's nothing they can do. He's covering his butt. The Meet Director looks like he might cry, but thinks bet of it. Rebecca bites her lip. INT. BEAM PODIUM - DURING WARM-UP - SWITCH.

dialogues.text: Monkey buggers.

dialogues.speaker: . HALEY

dialogues.text: It's your call. I wanna see your routine. ON TRICIA’S DISMOUNT, there’s APPLAUSE.. She salutes like she’s got it in the bag. . ON THE JUDGES, scribbling. ON TRICIA, blowing by the girls before stopping, turning, smirking at Beth and Haley.

dialogues.text: FINALISTS are CHEERING in the B.G., as a pumped Beth asce

dialogues.text: ON BETH, saluting at the GREEN LIGHT. And like a Missy Elliott video, she launches the most amazing hybrid of al time: a pop and lock, hip-hop beam routine. Her BREATHING HEARTBEAT and BODY SOUNDS creating her own personal SOUNDTRACK. Using the circumference of the four-inch beam and going i directions that are unusual for this apparatus, Beth thro dismount that’s more Crouching Tiger than Carly Patterson i ON THE JUDGES, looking uneasy.
